title: Senior Salesforce Consultant
job_function: Business Development, Information Technology, and Consulting
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Software Development
description:
**Senior Salesforce Consultant – Leading Nordic Salesforce Consultancy** 




  





 📍 Location: Stockholm / Gothenburg / Malmö (Hybrid)
 



 🗣 Language: Fluent Swedish Required
 



 💰 Salary: Competitive + Excellent Benefits
 



  





  





 We are working with a leading Salesforce consultancy across the Nordics, renowned for delivering transformative Salesforce solutions across both the public and private sectors. Due to ongoing growth, they are now looking for a Senior Salesforce Consultant to join their high-performing team.
 



  





 What You’ll Be Doing:
 


* Leading and delivering end-to-end Salesforce projects across Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Experience Cloud and others
* Engaging directly with clients to gather requirements, design scalable solutions, and implement best-in-class Salesforce configurations
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams across sectors, helping organisations maximise their Salesforce investments
* Supporting junior consultants and contributing to solution architecture discussions



  





 What they're Looking For:
 


* 3+ years of hands-on Salesforce experience
* Proven experience working with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Experience Cloud and others
* Salesforce certifications (e.g. Admin, Platform App Builder, Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant)
* Strong understanding of Salesforce best practices and client-facing consulting experience
* Fluent Swedish language skills (spoken & written) – essential
* A proactive mindset with strong communication and problem-solving skills



  





 What’s On Offer:
 


* Clear career progression and a supportive environment that values growth
* High salary and performance-based bonuses
* Full support for Salesforce certifications and ongoing professional training
* Opportunity to work on impactful projects across both public and private sector clients
* Flexible hybrid working and a strong Nordic work-life culture



  





***Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.***

title: Lead Salesforce Architect
description:
**Lead Salesforce Architect – Shape the Future of Salesforce at Sofigate**
 Would you like to join the leading business technology company in the Nordics? Do you speak both business and technology fluently? If yes, keep reading!
   

  

 We’re looking for a top-tier
 **Lead Salesforce Architect** 
 —a person who doesn’t just understand the platform but defines what great looks like in the Swedish Salesforce ecosystem. You’re not just technically sharp—you're already active in the market. You influence deals, guide strategic customers, and set the tone for what scalable, forward-looking Salesforce architecture should be. This role is not about joining a team. It’s about lifting an entire Salesforce department—technically, culturally, and commercially.
   

  

 You’ll work side by side with Sofigate’s leadership, key clients, Salesforce themselves, and our most senior consultants to ensure our Salesforce business stays ahead—technically innovative, commercially relevant, and architecturally world-class.
   

  

**Your Impact:**
* Drive Technical Excellence: Lead architecture decisions across multiple programs and industries. Set standards, enforce best practices, and ensure long-term scalability.
* Act as a Technical Force Multiplier: Mentor senior consultants, coach architects, and continuously raise the bar across our Salesforce delivery teams.
* Win Strategic Deals: Be at the center of our most important bids. Shape solutions that win large-scale clients and anchor long-term relationships.
* Represent Sofigate in the Ecosystem: You’re active in the Swedish Salesforce scene—this role gives you a platform to go even further.
* Accelerate Innovation: Help us explore and implement cutting-edge capabilities in AI, automation, and platform extensions (Agentforce, MuleSoft, etc.).
* Partner at the Top: Work directly with Salesforce, C-level clients, and internal executives on vision, value realization, and roadmaps.


**What we expect?**
* Deep technical and architectural knowledge across the Salesforce platform (core clouds and beyond)
* A strong presence in the Swedish Salesforce community
* Proven experience leading complex Salesforce transformations and large enterprise programs
* The ability to simplify complexity and explain architecture to both C-levels and developers
* Experience in strategic sales dialogues, from early ideation to final closure
* A mindset that balances governance, scalability, and fast delivery


**What’s in it for you?**
 As a Sofigator, you get the opportunity to work with knowledgeable and driven colleagues, develop and challenge yourself and create sustainable value for our customers. We have an international, vibrant and fun culture with great openness and flexibility. We value every Sofigator and strive to build a diverse, equal, and inclusive workplace where everyone’s voice is heard, and where everyone can become the best versions of themselves. We value a healthy work life balance and support you in maintaining it.
   

  

 Growth is not just a corporate thing for us – it is personal. There is so much to explore and learn within our community, and together with our customers, that having a bit of fun is unavoidable. We do not leave the future up to chance. We take ownership of it. You can, too.
   

  

**We would like to hear from you**
 Ready to drive transformation with Salesforce? Please, tell us more about your background, competences and your motivation to be part of our growth story by June 20, 2025. Join Sofigate and be part of something bigger!
   

  

 If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact Business Executive Johan Neumann (johan.neumann@sofigate.com)
   

  

**About Sofigate**
*We are The Business Technology Company with the fastest time-to-value in the gen AI era. We achieve that by combining our transformation expertise with low/no-code platforms and generative AI. That’s how we create sustainable customer value. In practice, that means helping our customers to develop the interplay between business and technology: to design, build and implement transformations and business-friendly technology solutions, like Salesforce, ServiceNow and SAP.*
*As leaders of Business Technology management, we are the founder of the Business Technology Forum, the developer of the* 
 Business Technology Standard
 *. Our team of 800+ professionals based in 8 offices across 5 countries – Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Hungary and Poland – are always ready to help, both our colleagues and our customers. At the very core of our being are our values: dare, care and grow. We dare to challenge the market, foster a community that cares about our people and drive growth with a customer centric business vision.*

title: Sales Specialist - Governance, Risk & Compliance
description:
Are you a results-driven salesperson who thrives on building relationships and closing deals? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing SaaS company where your work makes a real impact? Then this might be the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

 At Stratsys, we help our customers simplify their compliance work and strengthen their governance, risk, and security strategies. Our SaaS platform supports organizations in navigating complex regulatory landscapes, ensuring they stay ahead of requirements like NIS2, DORA, GDPR, and ISO 27001.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for someone with 1+ years of sales experience who wants to take the next step into a more consultative and strategic B2B sales role. You'll work with both new and existing customers, growing the business by closing new deals and expanding opportunities with current customers. You’ll be working with larger organizations and enterprises where the sales process can be complex and involve multiple stakeholders – but you don’t need to be an expert yet. We’ll help you grow!
   

  

**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
 **💡****
* You'll be joining a small but experienced team of four, split between Stockholm and Gothenburg. We work closely together, share knowledge, and support each other to succeed.
* You will be a part of a high-energy and familiar culture where colleagues become friends. Take a look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg.
* SEK 5,000 wellness allowance – we believe in staying active!
* A strong product, a growing market, and plenty of marketing support to help you succeed.


**About The Role  📌**
 As a Sales Specialist, you'll be responsible for bringing in new customers as well as expanding accounts that are already using other products within our platform but have not yet purchased our GRC solution.
   

  

**Your main tasks will include:**
* Finding and engaging new customers, showing them how our SaaS solutions can simplify compliance and risk management.
* Managing the entire sales process – from prospecting to closing deals.
* Expanding business within existing accounts by identifying new opportunities and deepening relationships with current customers.
* Building strong relationships with decision-makers in both private and public sector organizations.
* Conducting product demos, presentations, and tailored proposals.
* Negotiating contracts and handling agreements.
* Working closely with marketing, product development, project managers and customer success to create the best experience for our customers.


**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️**
 We’re looking for someone who’s hungry to learn and develop within SaaS sales. You might have 1–2 years of experience in sales and are now ready to take on a more strategic and relationship-driven role.
   

  

* University degree in Business Administration or similar.
* 1 + year with a proven track record in sales, particularly in a B2B environment and preferably from selling SaaS/Cloud-based solutions to C-levels.
* Comfortable engaging with senior decision-makers.
* A proactive and curious mindset – you want to develop and take ownership of your sales process.
* Strong negotiation and presentation skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


**Bonus points if you:**
* Experience in GRC, information security, or compliance-related solutions.
* Familiarity with regulations like NIS2, DORA, ISO 27001, or GDPR.
* Experience working with HubSpot or similar CRM systems.


**About You 👀**
 You're driven by sales, enjoy building strong pipelines, and love the challenge of winning new business. To succeed in this role, you bring a mix of curiosity, drive, and a strong interest in digitalization and business development. You’re used to working towards ambitious sales targets and know how to keep momentum in a sales process.
   

  

 At the same time, you thrive in a team environment where success is something you build together. You’re confident in speaking with decision-makers, take initiative to learn and improve, and enjoy sharing knowledge with others. With a positive, solution-oriented mindset and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively, you’ll be a great fit for our team.
   

  

**About Us 🚀**
 Does this sound like the perfect role for you? Don’t hesitate – apply today! We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Is this particular role not quite right for you -  Show your interest by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Do you want to learn more about your future colleagues and us and participate in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Commercial Engineer
description:
Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Trusted by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado Customer Experience Cloud empowers brands to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and grow their businesses.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Commercial Engineer at Voyado, you'll step into an exciting role at the intersection of technology, sales, partnerships
 **,** 
 and strategy. Supporting our Engage product, you’ll combine technical expertise with commercial acumen to drive our sales efforts and support our partners. You’ll play a pivotal role in understanding customer needs, delivering compelling product demonstrations, and tailoring solutions that address client challenges.
   

  

 If you thrive on blending tech-savvy insights with commercial problem-solving, this is your chance to shine!
   

  

 What you'll be up to
   

  

* Collaborate with the sales team and partners to identify customer needs and deliver tailored technical solutions.
* Conduct in-depth product demonstrations and technical presentations to showcase the capabilities of Voyado Engage.
* Address technical challenges, customizing solutions to ensure alignment with client requirements.
* Act as a bridge between sales, partner managers, and product teams, translating technical details into clear business benefits.
* Stay updated on product enhancements, industry trends, and the competitive landscape.


**About You**
 We’re looking for a dynamic professional ready to take the next step in their career. Ideally, you have a technical background and a business-oriented mindset, enjoy problem-solving, thrive in a collaborative environment, and have a knack for translating complex technical details into compelling value propositions.
   

  

*What We’re Looking Fo* 
*r:*
* Proven experience as a Sales Engineer, Solution Engineer, or a technical customer-facing role, such as working with implementing a SaaS Solution.
* Background working with complex digital products, preferably SaaS solutions.
* Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to simplify and engage.
* Creative problem-solving skills to address diverse customer needs.
* A team player who values collective success and collaboration.
* Motivated by the challenge of entering new markets and driving growth.
* Experience with CRM systems in the e-commerce industry is highly meritorious (and experience with Voyado Engage specifically is a strong plus).


 As we are growing internationally and have recently established ourselves on the German market, it would be very meritorious if you were fluent in German.
   

  

 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and put a lot of time and effort into keeping and nurturing our knowledge-sharing and friendly culture. We are personal, and that extends into everything about us. Read more about what it is like to work at Voyado
 **here** 
 .
   

  

 More on Voyado!
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. We empower retailers and e-commerce companies to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their businesses. We are a purpose-driven company where every opinion is valued, and every team member has the opportunity to make a meaningful impact. At Voyado, you’ll work in a self-driven environment with strong support from your team.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

 Before one applies, it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine, don't hesitate to send in your resume!
   

  

 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct a background check on the final candidate. We use background checks from Scandinavian Recruitment Intelligence. Here you can read more about how a background check is done.
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Senior Delivery Consultant, ProServe EMEA North
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Experience in Security, Risk, and Compliance
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience

**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. title: Software Support Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Software Support Engineer to…
   

  

 …work in a dynamic and exciting engineering role in Linux-based infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM), containerization (Docker/LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), OpenStack, Kubernetes and the open source applications running on top of them. It will challenge you to show the breadth of your engineering skills, which will be needed to work on almost any aspect of Ubuntu and the open source applications large enterprise customers run.
   

  

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have an affinity for open source software, great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require upstream bug fixes. Our engineers are able to work productively at any level of the stack including the kernel and in a wide range of languages, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.
   

  

 You will help with troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and bug fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a remote role, we have teams in all time zones.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Resolve complex customer problems related to Ubuntu, Kernel, Ceph, OpenStack, or Kubernetes and other open source software
* Maintain a close working relationship with Canonical's Field, Support and product engineering teams
* Participate in upstream communities
* Develop bug fixes, backport patches, and work with upstream for inclusion
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Demonstrate good judgment in technical methods and techniques
* Prioritize work and manage your time effectively against those priorities
* Participate in team discussions to improve processes, tools, and documentation
* Maintain clear, technical and concise communications
* Work from home and travel internationally up to 10% of work time for team meetings, events and conferences


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record
* Background in Computer Science, STEM or similar
* Experience with Linux and open source software
* Experience with at least one of Python, Go, C or C++ on Linux
* A drive to learn unfamiliar technology and deep-dive difficult issues
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have interest in, or willingness to learn about any of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD,Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, distributed systems


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

* Strong cloud infrastructure knowledge

title: Senior Delivery Consultant, ProServe EMEA North
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts

When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

* Experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* Experience in Mainframe Modernization
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience

**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)

 Job ID: A2990847

title: Riksbanken söker en Systemansvarig inom området IT arbetsplats
description:
Riksbankens mål är att IT ska vara en strategisk partner till verksamheten och vi har höga ambitioner att ligga i framkant med vårt IT-stöd. Just nu pågår flera spännande förändringsprojekt. Vi söker en ny medarbetare med bred teknisk IT-kompetens som vill ansvara för att förvalta och vidareutveckla flera av våra interna IT-system, i nära samarbete med verksamhet och leverantörer.
   

  

 VI ERBJUDER
   

  

 Hos oss ges utmanande arbetsuppgifter i en händelserik miljö där Sveriges ekonomiska utveckling står i fokus. Vi har kunniga och engagerade kollegor och det finns stora möjligheter till kompetensutveckling.
   

  

 DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS
   

  

 Som systemansvarig ingår du i ett förvaltningsteam som driver förvaltnings- och vidareutvecklingsarbetet av Riksbankens IT arbetsplats som exempelvis består av klient- och mobilitetsplattform, applikationsutbud, skrivartjänst, samarbetslösningar och teknik för digitala möten, telefonitjänst, användarupplevelse och supporttjänst. Du kommer i din roll att kravställa och beställa vidareutvecklings- och förvaltningsarbeten hos system- och driftsleverantörer, verifiera och testa leveranser, driva och delta i projekt och aktiviteter samt bidra i arbete med att lösa incidenter.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär att vara tekniskt ansvarig för verksamhetssystem och klientapplikationer. Du kommer vara systemförvaltarens kontaktperson gällande verksamhetssystemets implementering och integration samt, om systemet är egenutvecklat, dess funktionalitet. I rollen ingår att säkerställa att all systemdokumentation upprättas och underhålls.
   

  

 Du deltar i förvaltningsmöten och ansvarar för att informationen om verksamhetssystemet och dess relationer är korrekta i Riksbankens CMDB .
   

  

 Det ingår även att stödja förvaltningsledare i vissa aktiviteter hos IT och i verksamheten, stödja servicedesk när det behövs för att hantera beställningar och frågor från medarbetare samt att samarbeta med system- och driftleverantörer. Dokumentation och uppföljning genomförs löpande och bidrar till hög kvalitet och säkerhet i våra system.
   

  

 DITT TEAM
   

  

 Riksbankens IT-verksamhet leds av en IT-chef och består av sex enheter som leds av var sin enhetschef. Tjänsten är placerad på enheten för Arbetsplats och Stödsystem (EAS). Vi arbetar brett inom teamet och även om ditt huvudsakliga fokus kommer att vara tjänster inom området telefoni, digital kommunikation, och mobilitet, ser vi det som en självklarhet att stötta varandra och arbeta med fler områden inom enheten. Det skapar både trygghet och variation i arbetet. Arbetet sker processorienterat enligt ITIL och vår IT-miljö innehåller flera samhällskritiska system. Riksbanken har sedan 2013 outsourcat drift och Servicedesk till driftleverantör.
   

  

 MER OM DIG
   

  

 Krav
   

  

* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller närliggande områden alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig.
* Minst 5 års praktisk erfarenhet av drift, utveckling och förvaltning av lösningar för digital kommunikation och mobilitetsplattform/-lösningar.
* Kunskap om systemarkitektur, integrationer och vanliga nätverkstopologier
* God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Utbildning eller certifieringar inom Windows Server och Windows Client.
* Erfarenhet av telefonilösningar.
* Erfarenhet av tekniskt arbete inom området IT arbetsplats, exempelvis lösningar för samarbete, utskriftstjänst, mjukvarupaketering och –distribution samt säkerhetslösningar och härdning av klientoperativ
* Erfarenhet av test/certifiering samt produktlivscykelhantering av klienthårdvara, kringutrustning och mobiltelefoner.
* Erfarenhet av styrning och uppföljning av leverantörer.
* Erfarenhet av ITIL, pm3 och agila arbetsformer.
* Erfarenhet av upphandling av tjänster och produkter.
* Erfarenhet av informationssäkerhetsfrågor och cybersäkerhet.


 För tjänsten lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Du är drivande, självgående, initiativtagande, flexibel och serviceinriktad. Du är mycket strukturerad, bra på att analysera och kommunicera och tycker om att samarbeta. Flera av våra systemleverantörer finns i utlandet vilket gör det viktigt att man uttrycker sig mycket väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 MER OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Anställningstyp: Tillsvidareanställning, provanställning kan tillämpas
   

  

 Placering: Huvudkontoret Brunkebergstorg Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid
   

  

 Möjlighet att jobba distans: 2 dagar i veckan när arbetet tillåter
   

  

 Förmåner: Generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, subventionerad lunch och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att vi kontrollerar examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning.
   

  

 ATT JOBBA PÅ RIKSBANKEN
   

  

 Riksbanken är en myndighet under riksdagen som ser till att pengarna behåller sitt värde över tid och att betalningar kan ske säkert och effektivt. Vi ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt. Vi arbetar på medborgarnas uppdrag för en stark och säker ekonomi.
   

  

 ANSÖK
   

  

 Vi vill ha din ansökan med CV senast den 9 juni. Vi vill att du i denna rekrytering besvarar ett antal urvalsfrågor. På så vis kan du enkelt söka tjänsten och vi ges möjligheten att utvärdera våra kandidater på lika villkor. Logiska tester och arbetsprov kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att vi kontrollerar examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Global Lead - Public Safety & Critical Communications
description:
*Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. In this role you will be part of building Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.*
**The Role**
 We are seeking a Global Lead - Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications (MCX, 5G, Edge, IoT, PMR/TETRA migration). This role requires a strategic thinker and industry thought leader with experience in public safety networks, regulatory advisory, business modelling, and telecom innovation. The ideal candidate will drive strategy, presales, delivery, and partnerships for public safety and telecom innovation projects, advising governments, enterprises, and telecom operators on mission-critical networks, spectrum strategy, and regulatory compliance. Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Public Safety & Critical Communications: Lead migration from PMR/TETRA to 4G/5G; define strategic roadmaps; drive business development; act as thought leader; develop offerings for public safety and critical communications.
* 5G & IoT Strategy: Drive 5G service offerings; advise on 5G-enabled digital manufacturing and connectivity; engage with partners; conduct assessments; provide strategy and launch guidance.
* Spectrum & Network Strategy: Advise on spectrum acquisition and valuation; define network roadmaps; develop auction strategies.
* Regulation & Compliance: Support regulatory bodies in market analysis and cost modelling; define pricing structures; advise on policy frameworks.
* Marketing & Business Strategy: Conduct technology and market analysis; develop marketing strategies; support business diversification.


**Your profile**
* 20+ years of experience in telecom, connectivity, and public safety communications.
* Proven track record in public safety and mission-critical communications projects across Europe.
* Core Competencies: Strategic analysis; mission-critical communications; spectrum strategy; 5G & IoT; program management; regulatory expertise; innovation; technico-economic analysis.
* Industry & Technical Expertise: Public safety communications; telecom infrastructure; Industry 4.0 & IoT; regulatory compliance.
* Education & Certification: bachelor’s or master’s degree in relevant fields; certifications like PMP, SAFe Agilist, ITIL, TOGAF, or regulatory compliance certifications.
* You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Sales Executive (IT professional services)
description:
**We’re hiring a Sales Executive to help us accelerate our growth in the Swedish market! 🚀This is a chance to drive real impact - working with startups, scaleups, and enterprises across the Nordics and Western Europe.** 




  





**About Digital New Agency:** 




 We’re a growing, well-established IT services company specializing in product development, consulting, and nearshoring. Our clients - ranging from ambitious startups to leading enterprises are based mainly in the Nordics and Western Europe. Strong customer testimonials speak to the quality, reliability, and partnership mindset we bring to every collaboration. Having built a team of nearly 70 talented professionals, we’re now entering an exciting growth phase, with a strong focus on expanding our presence in the Swedish market. 
 



 We’re looking for a Sales Executive to join forces with our founders, strengthen client relationships, and help us win new, impactful projects.
 



  





**As the Sales Executive, you will:** 



* Work closely with the Founders and leadership team for direct support and a smooth onboarding experience
* Identify and engage new B2B leads in the Swedish market
* Build strong, lasting relationships with prospects and clients
* Manage the full sales cycle - from outreach to securing meetings with key decision-makers
* Collaborate with the tech team to tailor solutions to client needs
* Support pre-sales activities, RFPs, and client onboarding processes
* Represent the company at industry events (both digital and onsite)



  





**Why join us? 🌟** 



* At DNA we believe in clear communication - we regularly talk about what’s working, what’s not, and how we can make things better
* We don’t do layers of management - everyone has a voice and real influence on how we work
* We build long-term partnerships (both with our clients and with our team)
* We offer true flexibility - you’ll have the freedom to organize your work in the way that helps you perform at your best.



  





**What are we looking for? 🕵️‍♀️** 



* Experience in selling IT services (e.g., software development, consulting)
* Strong knowledge of the Swedish market and business culture
* Proven track record of success in B2B sales (we’ll be keen to hear about them during the recruitment process)
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English (written and spoken), enabling you to build strong business relationships with clients
* Someone located in Sweden, with strong connections and insight into the local business environment



  





**What makes you a perfect match? 🎯** 



* You are self-driven, goal-oriented, and proactive
* You believe that strong client relationships are the key to meaningful and lasting business growth



  





**How we work & what we offer 🏡** 



* We are open to both B2B and employment contract options and are happy to discuss which best suits your needs
* We offer a fair and motivating salary, tailored to your experience, expectations, and the impact you create
* Remote-first approach and the space to balance work with life outside the office. Our Stockholm office is located in Vasastan, in the Convendum co-working space

title: Enterprise Account Executive
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
At
 
 Frends iPaaS
 
 , we are dedicated to redefining the future of integrations and automatization. Our mission is to make integrations fast, easy, and transparent.
 



  





 Frends is expanding its presence in Sweden, and we’re looking for
 **top-performing, target-driven enterprise sales professional** 
 to join our growing team.
 



  





**In this role,** 
 your primary responsibility is to create new enterprise customers for our integration platform,
 
 Frends eiPaaS
 
 . We promise you full support from Frends sales organization and technical experts. At Frends, we have a low hierarchy and little bureaucracy, and we trust our people and give them space to operate. Of course, we expect results.
 



  





 If you enjoy working with a Nordic iPaaS leader and global challenger, a niche area to focus on technically, high speed, and growth with great people and a low hierarchy culture, this opportunity could be great for you!
 



  





**Frends iPaaS is** 
 a modern European, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller customers and in both private and public sectors in various industries.
 **Frends** 
 is recognized 3rd year in the
 **Gartner**
*®*
**Magic Quadrant™**
 for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends is also awarded in
 **G2 review**
 with the "Momentum Leader (API Management)," "Best Usability," "Easiest to Use & Admin," "Highest User Adoption," "Most Implementable," "Fastest Implementation," and "Fastest Time to Value" badges in 2025. Our customers give us 4.7 out of 5 stars on Gartner Peer Insights.
 



  





**🔥 About the Role** 




  





**As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will** 
 focus on new enterprise business acquisition. Your responsibility is to drive new customer growth by managing the full sales cycle—from prospecting to closing high-value enterprise deals.
 



  





 You will be at the forefront of our continued expansion in Sweden, working with a proven product, strong customer references, and an experienced team, including technical solution architects, to help you succeed.
 



  





**💼 What You Will Be Doing** 




  





 ✔
 **Own the full sales cycle** 
 – from prospecting to closing, driving new customer acquisition
 



 ✔
 **Expand our footprint in Sweden** 
 – Work strategically to grow our presence and maximize revenue potential
 



 ✔
 **Close high-value deals** 
 – Engage with CTOs, CIOs, and IT leaders to build strong business cases
 



 ✔
 **Develop and execute a winning sales strategy** 
 – Create a clear territory plan and exceed revenue targets
 



 ✔
 **Leverage top-tier SaaS sales methodologies** 
 – Apply MEDDIC, Challenger, and value-based selling to drive deal success
 



 ✔
 **Collaborate with Pre-Sales** 
 – Work with technical experts to deliver the best possible solutions for customers
 



  





**What it´s like to sell Frends?** 
 You can read Frends Senior Account Executive thoughts from our
 
 blog.
 




  





**🎯 Why Join Frends Now?** 




  




* **Be Part of a Strong, Scaling Team:** 
 Sweden is already established, and we are growing further
* **Make an Impact:** 
 Affect Frends' growth in Sweden, shaping success in this strategic region
* **Career Growth:** 
 Take on a critical role with continuous learning in a fast-growing company
* **Nordic Leader, Global Challenger:** 
 Join one of the Nordics' top integration technology organizations with its own platform, Frends, a well-established product with strong demand
* **Thriving Integration Field:** 
 Join a vital and growing field of integrations where your skills make a difference—
 
 integrations
 
 keep the world spinning
* **Pre-Sales Support:** 
 Collaborate with
 
 presales
 
 and other experts to craft the best solutions for diverse use cases
* **Work Flexibly:** 
 Enjoy modern, flexible working times and hybrid remote work
* **Competitive Compensation:** 
 Earn a fixed salary with performance-based incentives



  





**Read from our
 
 fresh blog
 
 why talents choose Frends and why Frendszies stay with us.** 




  





**💪 What You Bring** 




  





 ✅
 **Strong B2B SaaS / Software solution sales expertise** 
 – with a 5+ year track record of success in Saas/PaaS new business acquisition, you know how to sell value, navigate complex sales cycles, and influence key
 **Enterprise IT decision-makers** 




 ✅
 **Ability to navigate enterprise organizations,** 
 identifying key stakeholders and building a strong sales pipeline
 



 ✅
 **Ability to build pipeline & close deals** 
 – You take full ownership of your territory and prospecting strategy
 



 ✅
 **Knowledge & curiosity towards technical solutions** 
 – understanding of integration technology, familiarity with SaaS/PaaS solutions, ideally also iPaaS
 



 ✅
 **Fluent in high-impact SaaS sales methodologies** 
 – Familiarity with MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales, or similar
 



 ✅
 **Great communication & negotiation skills** 
 – You can confidently handle high-stakes sales conversations and adept at identifying and utilizing internal resources to support your sales cycle
 



**✅ Superb listening skills** 
 – You must understand and empathize with our customers/prospects' pain points with a solution and value-based mindset
 



  





 🌍
 **Location & Language: The role requires fluent/native Swedish and professional English** 
 (both verbally and in writing), as well as
 **living in Sweden with a work permit.** 
 We support hybrid work mode but also require visiting our Stockholm office in Katarinavägen on a weekly basis. Occasionally, traveling is needed to meet customers and teams and attend events.
 



  





**⭐ Interested in joining us? Apply now!** 




  





 If you want to impact and join our growth journey, please contact us and tell us more about yourself!
 



  





**Additional Information** 




  




* The start is flexible according to your situation, and we offer a permanent, full-time position.
